result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Jefferey Allen Lucas was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Joanne L Hardtke and Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO PHASE II:    
Written Jury Waiver received and filed.  Court examines Defendant regarding the decision to waive his right to a jury trial. Court finds that Defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently waives his right to have a jury trial.  Court grants Defendant's request for a Court Trial.
Court Trial proceeded.....
Sworn and testified:  Dr. Deborah Collins.
Testimony closed.
COURT'S RULING:  Court finds defendant is "not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect".

**Court ordered defendant to submit to a conditional release evaluation.

Defendant to remain on Justice Point Electronic Monitoring (GPS) for supervision with the same conditions of release as previously ordered.

Court adjourns this matter for PHASE III.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Phase 3 Court Trial and Return on Doctor's Report.

Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Joanne L Hardtke and Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO PHASE I:
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:    Defendant changes plea to "NO CONTEST". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form with Addendum.

for Examination Under Sec. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.  Copy emailed to the Forensic Unit on this date.

ENTRY CONTINUED.....
Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of his client. Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit - special request for examiner, Dr. Deborah Collins, as to the special plea.  

Court addressed bail:  Court set bail at $2,500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point GPS Electronic Monitoring for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) 24-Hour Curfew.  (2) No contact with the victims.  (3) No possession of any illegal drugs.  (4) No possession of weapons of any kind.  (5) Submit to random urine screens.  
Court "administratively" ordered the following exceptions to the 24-hour curfew:  **Doctor appointments and church only.

Court ordered case adjourned for Return on Doctor's NGI Report on 04-23-2015 at 1:30 PM - Branch 02, Judge Donald's Court.

No challenges to the doctor's report.
Court REINSTATED the proceedings today.

for Treatment; signed and filed.

Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

All parties previously reviewed the doctor's report. 
The doctor's competency report concludes that the defendant is NOT competent, but likely to regain competence.
The defendant challenges the competency report; states he is competent to proceed.
Court proceeds with a competency hearing.....

Sworn and testified as a witness for the State:  Dr. Deborah Collins.
Testimony closed.
Defendant made a statement.
Closing arguments.

COURT'S RULING:  Court finds the State has met its burden. Court finds defendant is NOT competent, but likely to regain competence.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  

**The Court further found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition, however, DHS is to confer with the defendant prior to administering any medications.  

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  

Case adjourned to 04-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Return on Competency Restoration Report.

Order of Commitment signed and filed.

Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Jefferey Allen Lucas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 2.  Court ordered time limits tolled for preliminary hearing.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court is informed by Sheriff defendant refuses to appear before Court Commissioner for an initial appearance.
The Court is informed by Attorney Devitt of the Public Defender Office,she attempted to interview defendant but he refused.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
